body_content.explanation: the fact of being able to survive (= to continue to live or exist, especially after coming close to dying or being destroyed):
examples: It is one of the most treatable of cancers, with a five-year survivability rate of 90 percent if caught early.
These weapons can greatly increase the survivability of the troops that use them.

body_content.explanation: the possibility of escaping from a particular thing without being killed or seriously hurt:
examples: Each of the cars tested got stars for crash survivability, four for the best and one for the poorest.
Both these events demonstrate the survivability of earthquakes when societies prepare correctly for them.
